spans.text: This song still lacks details that can touch people's hearts.

On the long wooden partition in front of the desk, the left side is filled with music-related books such as arrangement, and the right side is filled with refreshing drinks and filling jelly. The corners of the table and the trash can are filled with leftover packaging from drinks and jelly.

Because it is winter, there is no need to worry about the expiration date anymore. Taki specially piled them on the wooden shelf where they can be taken at any time, which can save time and avoid interrupting inspiration and affecting creation.
--Now, there is another reason not to worry about whether they will expire.
...I didn't expect this to be the last song so soon.
(I clearly still want to compose so many, many more songs.)
(Each one better than the last, until the moment my heart stops beating.)
(Meeting them, didn't I already grasp something? As long as I turn all of this into a song...)
An embarrassing empty sound came from her stomach, and Taki suddenly realized that she had not left her computer desk for half a step from morning to dusk.
There are still reserves in the refrigerator, but the current appetite cannot be satisfied by instant food or self-cooking alone.
...Let's go have a drink, it won't take two hours.
Alcohol might make things go smoother.
(Although it will take a lot of time on the road, I'm already prepared, aren't I... Even if it's the last time, I have to treat it like an ordinary day.)
(By the way... I'll go see if the old shopkeeper is feeling better.)
